userestrict.p: Use microfilm copy, Norfolk County (Va.) Reel 284.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Norfolk County (Va.) Reel 284, Local government records collection, Chesapeake (City)/Norfolk County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This item was generated by Backstage Library Works.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Norfolk County was formed from Lower Norfolk County in 1691. Now extinct, Norfolk County was incorporated into the City of Chesapeake in 1963.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Unrecorded Will Book 284, 1711-1762, of Norfolk County Court. This reel records information about individuals dying with a written will died in testate. After the death of an individual, his or her will was brought into court, where two of the subscribing witnesses swore that the document was genuine. After the will was proved, the executor was bonded to carry out his or her duties to settle the estate. The court then ordered the will to be recorded. This reel has an index.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Norfolk County Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm
